Lead Reliability Engineer- Drilling ServicesDo you like working in collaborative teams and solving critical issues?Do you have a passion for delivering all types of reliability solutions?Join our Drilling Services team!Our Drilling services Team provides industry-leading products and services that optimize the extraction, production, and processing of energy. We help a diverse range of customers across the value chain to reduce operating costs and improve productivity.Partner with the bestAs a Lead Reliability Engineer, you will be responsible for identifying, leading, and executing activities that are aimed at reducing the costs of failure caused by non-productive time, repair costs, personnel, and premature product failures.As a Lead Reliability Engineer, you'll be responsible for:Leading & participating in Incident Investigation, ensuring the end to end process is considered, (including job planning, preparation, and execution), when determining incident root cause(s) alongside appropriate corrective actions.
Focusing on preventing failures during the lifecycle management of a product or service through active monitoring and corrective action planning.
Supporting job planning and preparation by participating in Risk Assessment / deviation waiver / Management of Change (RA / DWR/ MOC) and deployment readiness assessment processes (DRA).
Executing the key steps outlined within the Field Incident Management Process (FIMP).
Managing the FRACAS DMAIC stages & identifying FRACAS trends to identify and prioritize failure modes to investigate for corrective actions.
Applying root cause analysis (RCA) processes and developing and review cause maps.
Developing RCA reports and technical or field bulletins.
Supporting new product development in all aspects relevant to reliability engineering, through direct liaison with engineering and the deploying region.Fuel your passionTo be successful in this role you will:Have a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering.
Have at least 7 years’ experience in reliability engineering
have Reliability Engineering experience within Drilling Services.
Have prior experience in roles such as: Field Engineer/Specialist or Remote Professional, product development, applications engineer, AMO engineer or other technical disciplines.
Demonstrate effective communication, interpersonal and leadership skills with the ability to influence others and lead teams.
Show the ability to work in a global matrix organization.Work in a way that works for youWe recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive.Working with usOur people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.Working for youOur inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input.
